text: is a type of Japanese food. It is very fresh fish which has been sliced into thin pieces.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Sashimi" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 343. Some sashimi is cooked, but most seafood is served fresh. The most popular fish in sashimi include: * * * * * * * * * * * * * The art of making sashimi is in the choice of fish and the way it is cut into pieces. ==Related pages== *Sushi ==References== ==Other websites== Category:Japanese food Category:Seafood dishes
